children.text: When learning how to code, one of the most commonly faced obstacles is escaping "tutorial hell", otherwise known as always following a tutorial in order to complete a project. I also found myself in this sort of situation while learning web development.

Something that helped me was to attempt the famous and very popular 100DaysOfCode challenge. The goal is to code for at least 1 hour over 100 days. During those days, I would set a goal of something tangible that I can code within that period. While I did not manage to do so daily or even accomplish what I had set my mind out to do, doing this helped me gained a more profound understanding of different techniques and allowed me to put what I've been learning to a much more practical use.
During this period, I completed some actual projects, a couple of which are displayed on my website!
